Basics

Button

An all purpose button in various states, sizes and colours.

Options as passed by the data:

  • element custom element instead of a
  • type optional type if button
  • url optional link if anchor
  • classes a list of classnames for the button
  • text the button label
  • is-static setting this to 1 removes all clickevents from the button without visual changes
  • is-disabled setting this to 1 applies visual changes, disables the button if is-button is 0
  • is-rounded setting this to 1 rounds out the button visually

The following require the use of one of the Colours

  • is-outlined setting this to 1 creates a ghost button
  • is-inverted setting this to 1 swaps $background-color and $color

Bulma documentation. Note the section about buttons and formgroups here

HTML

<a href="#" class="button is-dark">


</a>

YML data

element: null
type: null
url: '#'
classes: is-dark
text: null
icon: null
icon-description: null
is-disabled: 0
is-static: 0
is-rounded: 0
is-inverted: 0
is-outlined: 0

Forms

Checkbox

A default checkbox. It is intentionally not styled, to preserve cross-browser compatibility and the user experience.

Options as passed from the data:

  • classes a list of classnames to wrap the checkbox in.
  • label is the checkbox text. HTML such as links are allowed as long as escaped properly.
  • is-disabled setting this to 1 disables the checkbox. Default is 0
  • is-required setting this to 1 adds the required attribute used for validation (not included). Default is 0
  • is-checked setting this to 1 preticks the checkbox. Default is 0

Bulma documentation

HTML

<label class="checkbox " id="checkbox">
	<input type="checkbox" />
	Default <a href="">label</a>
</label>

YML data

classes: null
id: checkbox
label: Default <a href="">label</a>
is-checked: 0
is-disabled: 0
is-required: 0

File

A styled upload action. It comes in two different styles: default and is-boxed.

Options as passed from the data:

  • classes a list of classnames to wrap the File in. Supports most of Bulma's modifiers
  • is-boxed setting this to 1 changes the styling from inline to a boxed block button. Default is 0
  • has-name setting this to 1 adds a filename container. Used together with filename. Default is 0
  • filename the filename shown in the file-name container. Required has-name to be set
  • label is the button text. HTML is not allowed

Bulma documentation

HTML

<div class="file has-name  ">
	<label class="file-label">
		<input class="file-input" type="file" name="" id="file-example">
		<span class="file-cta">
			<span class="file-label">
				Choose file
			</span>
		</span>
		<span class="file-name">
			resume.docx
		</span>
	</label>
</div>

YML data

classes: null
id: file-example
label: Choose file
has-name: 1
is-boxed: 0
filename: resume.docx

Input

A form input element, used for all valid input types.

Options as passed from the data:

  • classes a list of classnames for the input. Supports most of Bulma's modifiers
  • id the id of the input. Make sure this matches a label's for when used together with a Label Basic
  • type changes the type of the input as specified by the input spec. Defaults to text when left blank
  • placeholder the placeholder of the input
  • value the value of the input. Typically used when the input should be prefilled.
  • is-disabled setting this to 1 disables the input. Default is 0
  • is-required setting this to 1 adds the required attribute used for validation (not included). Default is 0
  • is-static setting this to 1 removes styling while maintaining vertical spacing. Typically used with is-readonly. Default is 0
  • is-readonly setting this to 1 makes the input readonly. Default is 0

Bulma documentation

HTML

<input type="text" id="input-example" class="input  is-rounded" placeholder="Waar ben je naar op zoek?" value="" />

YML data

classes: is-rounded
type: text
id: input-example
placeholder: Waar ben je naar op zoek?
value: null
is-disabled: 0
is-required: 0
is-static: 0
is-readonly: 0

Label

Label element used for forms.

Options as passed from the data:

  • classes a list of classnames to wrap the label in. Supports most of Bulma's modifiers
  • text the label's text
  • for the label's for element.

HTML

<label class="label " for="label-example">Default label</label>

YML data

classes: null
text: Default label
for: label-example
id: label-id

Radio

The mutually exclusive radio buttons in their native format. It is intentionally not styled, to preserve cross-browser compatibility and the user experience.

Options as passed from the data:

  • id acts as the name for the radio group. Additionally generates an id for each radio wrapper by appending a number, e.g. example-1.
  • options a list of radiobuttons. Each their own set of options:
    • classes a list of classnames to wrap the radiobutton in.
    • value the value of the radiobutton.
    • is-disabled setting this to 1 disables the radiobutton. Default is 0
    • is-required setting this to 1 adds the required attribute used for validation (not included). Default is 0
    • is-checked setting this to 1 preticks the radiobutton. Default is 0

Bulma documentation

HTML

<label class="radio " id="radio-0">
	<input type="radio" name="radio" value="green" checked> Green
</label>
<label class="radio " id="radio-1">
	<input type="radio" name="radio" value="red"> Red
</label>
<label class="radio " disabled id="radio-2">
	<input type="radio" name="radio" value="blue" disabled> Blue
</label>

YML data

id: radio
options:
  - label: Green
    value: green
    classes: null
    is-checked: 1
    is-disabled: 0
  - label: Red
    value: red
    classes: null
    is-checked: 0
    is-disabled: 0
  - label: Blue
    value: blue
    classes: null
    is-checked: 0
    is-disabled: 1

Select

The browser native dropdown menu.

Options as passed from the data:

  • placeholder placeholder of the selectbox.
  • classes a list of classnames for the dropdown. Supports most of Bulma's modifiers
  • id the id of the dropdown. Make sure this matches a label's for when used together with a Label Basic
  • options a list of available options
  • groups a list of groups which contain a list of options
  • is-disabled setting this to 1 disables the dropdown menu. Default is 0
  • is-required setting this to 1 adds the required attribute used for validation (not included). Default is 0
  • is-multiple setting this to anything other than 0 enables the browser native multiple-select behaviour. The amount of items shown initially is identical to the value of is-multiple

Bulma documentation

HTML

<div class="select  ">
	<select id="selectbox">
		<option value="" selected disabled>Choose</option>
		<option value="Pink Floyd">Pink Floyd</option>
		<option value="Ringo Starr">Ringo Starr</option>
		<optgroup label="Beatles">
			<option value="Ringo">Ringo</option>
			<option value="John">John</option>
			<option value="Paul">Paul</option>
			<option value="George">George</option>
		</optgroup>
		<optgroup label="Bee Gees">
			<option value="Barry Gibb">Barry Gibb</option>
			<option value="Robin Gibb">Robin Gibb</option>
			<option value="Maurice Gibb">Maurice Gibb</option>
			<option value="Don Henley">Don Henley</option>
		</optgroup>
	</select>
</div>

YML data

placeholder: Choose
classes: null
id: selectbox
is-multiple: 0
is-disabled: 0
is-required: 0
options:
  - Pink Floyd
  - Ringo Starr
groups:
  - label: Beatles
    options:
      - Ringo
      - John
      - Paul
      - George
  - label: Bee Gees
    options:
      - Barry Gibb
      - Robin Gibb
      - Maurice Gibb
      - Don Henley

Textarea

A multiline textarea.

Options as passed from the data:

  • classes a list of classnames for the textarea. Supports most of Bulma's modifiers
  • id the id of the textarea. Make sure this matches a label's for when used together with a Label Basic
  • placeholder the placeholder of the textarea
  • value the value of the input. Typically used when the textarea should be prefilled
  • rows the amount of visible rows, affecting the height. Default is blank
  • is-disabled setting this to 1 disables the textarea. Default is 0
  • is-required setting this to 1 adds the required attribute used for validation (not included). Default is 0
  • is-readonly setting this to 1 makes the textarea readonly. Default is 0

Bulma documentation

HTML

<textarea class="textarea " id="textarea-example" placeholder="Default placeholder" rows="6">lorem ipsum</textarea>

YML data

classes: null
id: textarea-example
placeholder: Default placeholder
value: lorem ipsum
rows: 6
is-disabled: 0
is-required: 0
is-readonly: 0

Icon

Icon Basic using FontAwesome. FontAwesome IconFont not included by default.
Bulma is compatible with all icon font libraries: Font Awesome 5, Font Awesome 4, Material Design Icons, Ionicons, etc.
Setup specific IconFont per project.

Options as passed by the data:

  • name name of icon
  • size optional size of the icon. Accepts small, medium, large. Not using a size class puts the icon size between small and medium.
  • classes additional classes of icon

Bulma documentation

HTML

<span class="icon">
	<i class="fas fa-home"></i>
</span>

YML data

name: home
size: null
classes: null

Image

A container for reponsive images. The size is attached to the container rather than the image itself to prevent layout issues when the image takes longer to load.
There are two types available, sized images and ratio images.
Note the difference in notation, 32x32 versus 4by3.

Sized images
These are specifically sized square images, typically used for packshots or avatars. Images placed in this container will size to specified size regardless of source material. Useful for retina screens where you would use higher resolution images.
The list of available sizes are specified in src/assets/toolkit/styles/theme/variables.scss, in the $dimensions variable. The appropriate classes are then generated by sass (ie is-64x64).
Make sure to update this documentation when the list is modified!

Ratio images
Images placed in this container will always fill the entire width available while growing in height according to the ratio. Useful for responsive scalable images in which the ratio is important, e.g. article headers.

Options as passed by the data:

  • classes a list of classnames for the container
  • url the url to the source images relative to /assets/toolkit/images/
  • alt the text alternative.
  • is-rounded changing this to 1 results in a circular image. Default is 0.
  • size the size or ratio the images should adhere to.
    • for sized images these are speciefied in $dimensions (see above). Defaults are 16x16, 24x24, 32x32, 48x48, 64x64, 96x96, 128x128
    • available ratios are: 1by1, 4by3, 3by2, 16by9, 2by1

Bulma documentation

HTML

<figure class="image 128x128 ">
	<img src="./../assets/toolkit/images/temp/128x128.png" alt="Default image" />
</figure>

YML data

classes: null
size: 128x128
url: temp/128x128.png
alt: Default image
is-rounded: 0

Progress

A html native progress bar.

Options as passed from the data:

  • classes a list of classes for the progress element. Supports colour and size modifiers
  • max the bar's maximum value
  • value the bar's current value

Bulma documentation

25

HTML

<progress class="progress " value="25" max="100">25</progress>

YML data

classes: null
max: 100
value: 25

Search Bar

A form input element, used for all valid input types.

Options as passed from the data:

  • classes a list of classnames for the input. Supports most of Bulma's modifiers
  • id the id of the input. Make sure this matches a label's for when used together with a Label Basic
  • type changes the type of the input as specified by the input spec. Defaults to text when left blank
  • placeholder the placeholder of the input
  • value the value of the input. Typically used when the input should be prefilled.
  • is-disabled setting this to 1 disables the input. Default is 0
  • is-required setting this to 1 adds the required attribute used for validation (not included). Default is 0
  • is-static setting this to 1 removes styling while maintaining vertical spacing. Typically used with is-readonly. Default is 0
  • is-readonly setting this to 1 makes the input readonly. Default is 0

Bulma documentation

Artikelen Pagina's Categorien

Taartvorm met losse bodem, metaal 10 cm Taartvorm met losse bodem, metaal, 21x21cm Taartvorm met losse bodem, metaal, 35x11cm Taart-/ quichevorm, porselein, 22 cm
Bekijk alle resultaten (16)

HTML

<input type="text" id="input-example" class="input  " placeholder="Waar ben je naar op zoek?" value="" />
<img class="search-icon" src="../assets/toolkit/images/temp/icon-search-bar.svg" alt="Search icon" />
<img class="close-icon is-hidden" src="../assets/toolkit/images/temp/icon-close.svg" alt="Close icon" />
<nav class="panel is-hidden">
	<p class="panel-tabs">
		<a class="panel-tab is-active">Artikelen</a>
		<a class="panel-tab">Pagina's</a>
		<a class="panel-tab">Categorien</a>
	</p>
	<a class="panel-block">
		Taartvorm met losse bodem, metaal  10 cm
	</a>
	<a class="panel-block">
		Taartvorm met losse bodem, metaal, 21x21cm
	</a>
	<a class="panel-block">
		Taartvorm met losse bodem, metaal, 35x11cm
	</a>
	<a class="panel-block">
		Taart-/ quichevorm, porselein,  22 cm
	</a>
	<div class="panel-block">
		<a href="overview.html" class="button is-dark">
			Bekijk alle resultaten (16)
		</a>
	</div>
</nav>

YML data

classes: is-rounded
type: text
id: input-example
placeholder: Waar ben je naar op zoek?
value: null
is-disabled: 0
is-required: 0
is-static: 0
is-readonly: 0

Table

A default table used for tabular data. Cellpadding is relative to the font size to ensure a cleaner layout.

Options as passed from the data:

  • classes a list of classnames for the table.
  • is-narrow setting this to 1 reduces the padding of each cell for a smaller look. Default is 0
  • is-fullwidth setting this to 1 makes the table fill out all available space. Default is 0
  • is-bordered setting this to 1 adds borders to all cells. Default is 0
  • is-striped setting this to 1 adds zerba striping for legibility. Default is 0
  • is-hoverable setting this to 1 adds a hover effect to each row, sometimes increasing legibility. Default is 0

The content of the table itself is passed in YAML in the same structure as in html:

  • thead and/or tfoot. These are optional.
    • classes a list of classnames for the row
    • cells a list of for this row, each with two options:
      • text the content of the cell. HTML is allowed if escaped properly
      • classes a list of classnames for the cell
  • tbody
    • row each instance generates another tr
      • classes a list of classnames for the row
      • cells a list of cells for this row, each with the following options:
        • text the content of the cell. HTML is allowed if escaped properly
        • classes a list of classnames for the cell

Bulma documentation

One Two Three
Four Five Six
Seven Eight Nine
Ten Eleven Twelve

HTML

<table class="table ">
	<thead>
		<tr class="">
			<th class="">One</th>
			<th class="">Two</th>
			<th class="">Three</th>
		</tr>
	</thead>
	<tbody>
		<tr class="">
			<td class="">Four</td>
			<td class="">Five</td>
			<td class="">Six</td>
		</tr>
		<tr class="">
			<td class="">Seven</td>
			<td class="">Eight</td>
			<td class=""><a href="">Nine</a></td>
		</tr>
	</tbody>
	<tfoot>
		<tr class="">
			<th class="">Ten</th>
			<th class="">Eleven</th>
			<th class="">Twelve</th>
		</tr>
	</tfoot>
</table>

YML data

classes: null
is-narrow: 0
is-fullwidth: 0
is-striped: 0
is-bordered: 0
is-hoverable: 0
thead:
  classes: null
  cells:
    - text: One
    - text: Two
    - text: Three
tfoot:
  classes: null
  cells:
    - text: Ten
    - text: Eleven
    - text: Twelve
tbody:
  - row:
      classes: null
      cells:
        - text: Four
        - text: Five
        - text: Six
  - row:
      classes: null
      cells:
        - text: Seven
        - text: Eight
        - text: <a href="">Nine</a>

Tag

Tag labels, typically used for filters.
When using multiple tags, the use of a .tags container is advised. Read more

Options as passed by the data:

  • classes a list of classnames for the tag. Supports colour and size modifiers
  • text the text shown in the tag
  • has-delete setting this to 1 adds a delete button to the tag. Default is 0

Bulma documentation

Package

HTML

<span class="tag ">Package </span>

YML data

classes: null
text: Package
has-delete: 0

Title

Simple headings to add depth to the page.

Options as passed by the data:

  • element custom element instead of h{{size}}
  • classes a list of classnames for the h element
  • text the title text. HTML is allowed if escaped properly
  • subtitle setting this to 1 results in a subtitle, which behaves differently when paired with a title
  • size changes the size of the title to preset values. Ranges from 1 (biggest) to 6 (smallest). Default is 3. When using a subtitle a size difference of two is recommended
  • is-spaced setting this to 1 restores the spacing when succeeded by a subtitle

Bulma documentation

Lorem ipsum

HTML

<h3 class="title is-3 ">Lorem ipsum</h3>

YML data

element: null
classes: null
text: Lorem ipsum
size: 3
subtitle: 0
is-spaced: 0
